PIT_PKG

Declares the core PIT logic. This package is called by PIT as the API for PIT_PKG only.

Author

Juergen Sieben, ConDeS GmbH

Published under MIT licence

Maintenance
initialize
procedure initialize

Initialization procedure.

Made public to allow for any session to re-initialize PIT. As the actual status is persisted in a global context, initializing PIT will effectively re-initialize all PIT package instances across sessions.

Core methods
check_datatype
function check_datatype(
p_value in varchar2,
p_type in varchar2,
p_format_mask in varchar2,
p_accept_null in boolean
)
return boolean

Implements a data type check for a given VARCHAR2 value.

Parameters
p_value
in varchar2

Value to check

p_type
in varchar2

Expected data type. One of the C_TYPE_... constants

p_format_mask
in varchar2

Format mask to convert a string to the target value. May be NULL.

p_accept_null
in boolean

Define whether a value must exist. If set to TRUE, a NULL value returns TRUE and FALSE otherwise.

Returns

TRUE, if the value could be casted to the requested data type, FALSE if not.

enter
procedure enter(
p_action in pit_util.ora_name_type,
p_params in msg_params,
p_trace_level in pls_integer,
p_client_info in varchar2
)

Traces entering a method and maintains a call stack.

Parameters
p_action
in pit_util.ora_name_type

Name of the block that is executed. Normally the procedure or function name within a package.

p_params
in msg_params

List of parameters which is passed into tracing. Only VARCHAR2 is allowed as a parameter value with a maximum of 4000 byte.

p_trace_level
in pls_integer

Trace level to allow for selective tracing.

p_client_info
in varchar2

Optional info to be passed to DBMS_APPLICATION_INFO,

get_active_message
function get_active_message
return message_type

Retrieves the actually instantiated message instance.

Returns

Instance of type MESSAGE_TYPE that has been instantiated by PIT before

get_message
function get_message(
p_message_name in pit_util.ora_name_type,
p_msg_args in msg_args,
p_affected_id in pit_util.max_sql_char,
p_affected_ids in msg_params default null,
p_error_code in varchar2
)
return message_type

Returns an instance of type MESSAGE_TYPE. It takes the message_name, constructs an instance of MESSAGE_TYPE and returns the message instance.

Parameters
p_message_name
in pit_util.ora_name_type

Name of the message to log

p_msg_args
in msg_args

List of replacement values for the message

p_affected_id
in pit_util.max_sql_char

ID of an object that is affected by this message

p_affected_ids
in msg_params

Optional list of parameters a message relates to

p_error_code
in varchar2

Additional error code, used in external applications

Returns

Instance of the requested message.

Name of the message to log

p_msg_args

get_trans_item
function get_trans_item(
p_pti_pmg_name in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type,
p_pti_id in pit_translatable_item.pti_id%type,
p_msg_args msg_args,
p_pti_pml_name in pit_message_language.pml_name%type
)
return pit_util.translatable_item_rec

Function to retrieve a PIT translatable item (PTI).

Parameters
p_pti_pmg_name
in pit_message_group.pmg_name%type

Name of the message group the PTI belongs to

p_pti_id
in pit_translatable_item.pti_id%type

ID of the item to retreive translations for

p_msg_args
msg_args

MSG_ARGS object to adjust NAME or DISPLAY_NAME of the PTI

p_pti_pml_name
in pit_message_language.pml_name%type

Oracle language reference

Returns

Record of type PIT_UTIL.TRANSLATABLE_ITEM_REC with access to PTI_NAME, PTI_DISPLAY_NAME and PTI_DESCRIPTION

handle_error
procedure handle_error(
p_severity in pls_integer,
p_message_name in pit_util.ora_name_type default null,
p_msg_args in msg_args default null,
p_affected_id in pit_util.max_sql_char default null,
p_affected_ids in msg_params default null,
p_error_code in varchar2 default null,
p_params in msg_params default null
)

Handels an error. It takes the message_name and constructs an instance of MESSAGE_TYPE for it.  It then calls raises an error with the respective message that can be caught by the exception block.  Messages with severity error or fatal have an associated error called <MESSAGE_NAME>_ERR that can be used to capture the error.

Attention

The postfix or prefix for an exception depends on the installation of PIT and may differ.

Parameters
p_severity
in pls_integer

Severity of the message to log (FATAL|ERROR)

p_message_name
in pit_util.ora_name_type

Name of the message to log

p_msg_args
in msg_args

List of replacement values for the message

p_affected_id
in pit_util.max_sql_char

ID of an object that is affected by this message

p_affected_ids
in msg_params

Optional list of parameters a message relates to

p_error_code
in varchar2

Additional error code, used in external applications

p_params
in msg_params

Instance of MSG_PARAMS with a list of key-value pairs representing parameter name and -value.

leave
procedure leave(
p_trace_level in pls_integer,
p_params in msg_params,
p_severity in binary_integer default null
)

Traces leaving a method, calculates timing information if requested and maintains a call stack.

Parameters
p_trace_level
in pls_integer

Trace level to allow for selective tracing.

p_params
in msg_params

Instance of msg_params with a list of key-value pairs representing parameter name and -value.

p_severity
in binary_integer

Indicates whether leave was called in the vicinity of error handling. Based on severity, either any entry up to the calling entry is popped from stack or the stack is completely emptied.

tweet
procedure tweet(
p_message in varchar2
)

Lightweight message for temporary comments additiona debug information.

Does not require full messages, will not translate nor will it generate environment information such as call stack or error stack information.

Parameter
p_message
in varchar2

Textmessage to tweet

log_event
procedure log_event(
p_severity in pls_integer,
p_message_name in pit_util.ora_name_type default null,
p_msg_args in msg_args default null,
p_affected_id in pit_util.max_sql_char default null,
p_affected_ids in msg_params default null,
p_error_code in varchar2 default null
)

Logs messages. It takes the message_name and constructs an instance of MESSAGE_TYPE for it.  It then calls any log procedure of all active output modules and passes the message.

Parameters
p_severity
in pls_integer

Log-level. Allows to decide whether PIT should log or not.  If 0, the message gets logged anyway, regardless of log settings

p_message_name
in pit_util.ora_name_type

Name of the message to log

p_msg_args
in msg_args

List of replacement values for the message

p_affected_id
in pit_util.max_sql_char

Optional ID of an item a log entry relates to

p_affected_ids
in msg_params

Optional list of parameters a message relates to

p_error_code
in varchar2

Additional error code, used in external applications and to distinguish several occurences of the same message.

log_explicit
procedure log_explicit(
p_message_name in pit_util.ora_name_type,
p_affected_id in pit_util.max_sql_char,
p_affected_ids in msg_params default null,
p_error_code in varchar2,
p_msg_args in msg_args,
p_log_threshold in pit_message.pms_pse_id%type,
p_log_modules in pit_util.max_sql_char
)

Logs messages regardless of log settings. It takes the message_name and constructs an instance of MESSAGE_TYPE for it. It then calls any log procedure of all active output modules and passes the message, regardless of the actual log settings.

This method is used to provide a mechanism to log different messages to a certain set of log modules only.

Parameters
p_message_name
in pit_util.ora_name_type

Name of the message to log

p_affected_id
in pit_util.max_sql_char

Optional ID of an item a log entry relates to

p_affected_ids
in msg_params

Optional list of parameters a message relates to

p_error_code
in varchar2

Additional error code, used in external applications

p_msg_args
in msg_args

List of replacement values for the message

p_log_threshold
in pit_message.pms_pse_id%type

Threshold that is taken as a comparison to the message severity to decide whether a message should be logged

p_log_modules
in pit_util.max_sql_char

List of output modules to log to. This list is taken for this single call only. It does not affected the overall log module settings for the active or default context

log_state
procedure log_state(
p_params in msg_params,
p_severity in pit_message_severity.pse_id%type default null
)

Logs parameters. It expects an instance of MSG_PARAMS, containing variable names and their actual value. Useful if you want to log the state of variables without the context of a method call, fi to debug state within a loop.

Optionally, you may add an ID to reference an item.

Parameters
p_params
in msg_params

List of replacement values for the message

p_severity
in pit_message_severity.pse_id%type

Optional log level of the state message. Values get logged only if the actual log settings are lower (mor severe) or equal to P_SEVERITY.  If NULL, parameter LOG_STATE_THRESHOLD controls whether the params get logged or not.

notify
procedure notify(
p_message_name in pit_util.ora_name_type,
p_affected_id in pit_util.max_sql_char,
p_affected_ids in msg_params default null,
p_msg_args in msg_args,
p_log_threshold in pit_message.pms_pse_id%type,
p_log_modules in pit_util.max_sql_char
)

Notifies output modules.It takes the message_name and constructs an instance of MESSAGE_TYPE for it.  It then calls any notify procedure of all active output modules and passes the message.

Notifications are meant to be used for progress messages and the like.

Parameters
p_message_name
in pit_util.ora_name_type

Name of the message to log

p_affected_id
in pit_util.max_sql_char

Optional ID of an item a log entry relates to

p_msg_args
in msg_args

List of replacement values for the message

p_log_threshold
in pit_message.pms_pse_id%type

Threshold that is taken as a comparison to the message severity to decide whether a message should be logged

p_log_modules
in pit_util.max_sql_char

List of output modules to log to. This list is taken for this single call only. It does not affected the overall log module settings for the active or default context

print
procedure print(
p_message_name in pit_util.ora_name_type,
p_msg_args in msg_args
)

Prints a message to the output modules. Used to pass user information to the view layer.  It takes the message_name and constructs an instance of MESSAGE_TYPE for it.  It then calls any print procedure of all active output modules and passes the message.

Parameters
p_message_name
in pit_util.ora_name_type

Name of the message to log

p_msg_args
in msg_args

List of replacement values for the message

purge_log
procedure purge_log(
p_date_before in date,
p_severity_lower_equal in pls_integer
)

Purges the message stack after a given point in time.

  • P_DATE_BEFORE determines which entries to purge.

  • P_SEVERITY_GREATER_EQUAL determines which severity is to be purged.

Example

Setting it to 40 will purge all entries with severity of 40 and greater.

Parameters
p_date_before
in date

Date before which the message log is purged

p_severity_lower_equal
in pls_integer

Optional severity level that controls which severity of messages shall be purged.  Includes all messages with severity <code>P_SEVERITY_GREATER_EQUAL</code> and lower

raise_error
procedure raise_error(
p_severity in pls_integer,
p_message_name in pit_util.ora_name_type default null,
p_msg_args in msg_args default null,
p_affected_id in pit_util.max_sql_char default null,
p_affected_ids in msg_params default null,
p_error_code in varchar2 default null
)

Raises an error. It takes the message_name and constructs an instance of MESSAGE_TYPE for it.  It then calls raises an error with the respective message that can be caught by the exception block.  Messages with severity error or fatal have an associated error called <MESSAGE_NAME>_ERR that can be used to capture the error.

Attention

The postfix or prefix for an exception depends on the installation of PIT and may differ.

Parameters
p_severity
in pls_integer

Severity of the message to raise (FATAL|ERROR)

p_message_name
in pit_util.ora_name_type

Name of the message to raise

p_msg_args
in msg_args

List of replacement values for the message

p_affected_id
in pit_util.max_sql_char

ID of an object that is affected by this message

p_affected_ids
in msg_params

Optional list of parameters a message relates to

p_error_code
in varchar2

Additional error code, used in external applications

Context maintenance
set_context
procedure set_context(
p_context_name in varchar2 default null,
p_log_level in integer default null,
p_trace_level in integer default null,
p_trace_timing in boolean default null,
p_log_modules in varchar2 default null
)

Procedure to change the settings in the global PIT_CONTEXT.

This procedure is used if log settings have to be changed dynamically.  This method is either called with an existing context name or with explicit log settings.  If the method is called with an exising context name, the settings are derived from the parameters for that context. Otherwise, an anonymous context is copied to the active context.

Parameter
p_context_name
in varchar2

Optional name of the context

p_log_level
in integer

Optional log level of the context

p_trace_level
in integer

Optional trace level of the context

p_trace_timing
in boolean

Optional flag to indicate whether timing should be switched on

p_log_modules
in varchar2

Optional list of log modules to log to

get_context_value
function get_context_value(
p_name in varchar2
)
return varchar2

Method to get a context value eplicitly. Is used to retrieves sert values from the context.  This allows for maintaining information such as a test flag in a cross session aware manner.

Parameter
p_name
in varchar2

Name of the attribute to get

Returns

Value of the attribute <P_NAME>

set_context_value
procedure set_context_value(
p_name in varchar2,
p_value in varchar2
)

Method to set a context value eplicitly. Is used to persist arbitrary values at the context.  This allows for maintaining information such as a test flag in a cross session aware manner.  Setting an attribute to NULL eliminates this attribute from the context.

Parameters
p_name
in varchar2

Name of the attribute to set

p_value
in varchar2

Value to set, VARCHAR2 up to 4000 bytes.

Collect mode methods
get_collect_least_severity
function get_collect_least_severity
return binary_integer

Method to retrieve the actually least severity during collect mode.

Is used to examine during collect mode whether an error or fatal error has occurred.  Based on this information, validation logic may be executed or not.

Returns

Least severity received so far

get_collect_mode
function get_collect_mode
return boolean

Method to read the actually set collection mode.

Returns: TRUE, if PIT is in collect mode, FALSE otherwise.

set_collect_mode
procedure set_collect_mode(
p_mode in boolean
)

Procedure to toggle PIT collection mode.

Is used to set PIT to collect mode, where all messages are collected rather than thrown or processed immediate.  This mode allows for validation methods to perfrom all internal validations prior to raising validation errors.

  • If collection mode is switched off by passing FALSE into this function, the list of raised messages is examined.

  • If at least one message of secverity C_LEVEL_FATAL is present, exception PIT_BULK_FATAL is raised.

  • If at least one message of secverity C_LEVEL_ERROR is present, exception PIT_BULK_ERROR is raised.

Parameter
p_mode
in boolean

Flag to indicate whether PIT must collect messages (TRUE) or not (FALSE);

get_message_collection
function get_message_collection
return pit_message_table

Method to retrieve the collection of messages raised since setting PIT to collect mode.

Is used to retrieve a list of all messages raised during the collect cycle. It implicitly terminates collection mode by calling set_collect_mode with FALSE if PIT is still in collection mode.  Normal usage is terminating collection mode explicity and deal with the list of messages in the exception block.

Returns

Instance of PIT_MESSAGE_TABLE, a list of message instances
